content.text: He could feel the firehouse full of glitter and shine and silence, of brass colours, the colours of coins, of gold, of silver
The unseen men across the table were sighing on their cards, waiting.
These men who look steadily into their platinum igniter flames as they light their eternally burning black pipes.
They and their charcoal hair and soot-coloured brows and bluish-ash-smeared cheeks where they had shaven close; but their heritage showed.
You go up to the paper and it reads:
Rule 1. Answer the alarm swiftly. Rule 2. Start the fire swiftly. Rule 3. Burn everything.
Rule 4. Report back to firehouse immediately. Rule 5. Stand alert for other alarms
